name: child
description: A character vector of filenames. Knitr will knit the files and place them into the main document.

name: code
description: Set to R code. Knitr will replace the code in the chunk with the code in the code option.

name: engine
description: Knitr will evaluate the chunk in the named language, e.g. engine = 'python'. Run names(knitr::knit_engines$get()) to see supported languages.

name: eval
description: If FALSE, knitr will not run the code in the code chunk.

name: include
description: If FALSE, knitr will run the chunk but not include the chunk in the final document.

name: purl
description: If FALSE, knitr will not include the chunk when running purl() to extract the source code.

name: collapse
description: If TRUE, knitr will collapse all the source and output blocks created by the chunk into a single block.

name: echo
description: If FALSE, knitr will not display the code in the code chunk above it’s results in the final document.

name: results
description: If 'hide', knitr will not display the code’s results in the final document. If 'hold',knitr will delay displaying all output pieces until the end of the chunk. If 'asis',knitr will pass through results without reformatting them (useful if results return raw HTML,etc.)

name: error
description: If FALSE, knitr will not display any error messages generated by the code.

name: message
description: If FALSE, knitr will not display any messages generated by the code.

name: warning
description: If FALSE, knitr will not display any warning messages generated by the code.

name: comment
description: A character string. Knitr will append the string to the start of each line of results in the final document.

name: highlight
description: If TRUE, knitr will highlight the source code in the final output.

name: prompt
description: If TRUE, knitr will add > to the start of each line of code displayed in the final document.

name: strip.white
description: If TRUE, knitr will remove white spaces that appear at the beginning or end of a code chunk.

name: tidy
description: If TRUE, knitr will tidy code chunks for display with the tidy_source() function in the formatR package.

name: opts.label
description: The label of options set in knitr:: opts_template() to use with the chunk.

name: R.options
description: Local R options to use with the chunk. Options are set with options() at start of chunk. Defaults are restored at end.

name: ref.label
description: A character vector of labels of the chunks from which the code of the current chunk is inherited.

name: autodep
description: If TRUE, knitr will attempt to figure out dependencies between chunks automatically by analyzing object names.

name: cache
description: If TRUE, knitr will cache the results to reuse in future knits. Knitr will reuse the results until the code chunk is altered.

name: cache.comments
description: If FALSE, knitr will not rerun the chunk if only a code comment has changed.

name: cache.lazy
description: If TRUE, knitr will use lazyload() to load objects in chunk. If FALSE, knitr will use load() to load objects in chunk.

name: cache.path
description: cache.vars NULL A character vector of object names to cache if you do not wish to cache each object in the chunk.

name: dependson
description: A character vector of chunk labels to s

name: dev
description: The R function name that will be used as a graphical device to record plots, e.g. dev='CairoPDF'.

name: dev.args
description: Arguments to be passed to the device, e.g. dev.args=list(bg='yellow', pointsize=10).

name: dpi
description: A number for knitr to use as the dots per inch (dpi) in graphics (when applicable).

name: external
description: If TRUE, knitr will externalize tikz graphics to save LaTex compilation time (only for the tikzDevice::tikz() device).

name: fig.align
description: How to align graphics in the final document. One of 'left', 'right', or 'center'.

name: fig.cap
description: A character string to be used as a figure caption in LaTex.

name: fig.env
description: The Latex environment for figures.

name: fig.ext
description: The file extension for figure output, e.g. fig.ext='png'.

name: fig.height
description: The height to use in R for plots created by the chunk (in inches).

name: fig.width
description: The width to use in R for plots created by the chunk (in inches).

name: fig.keep
description: If 'high', knitr will merge low-level changes into high level plots. If 'all', knitr will keep all plots (low-level changes may produce new plots). If 'first', knitr will keep the first plot only. If 'last', knitr will keep the last plot only. If 'none', knitr will discard all plots.

name: fig.lp
description: A prefix to be used for figure labels in latex.

name: fig.path
description: fig.pos '' fig.process NULL fig.retina 1 fig.scap NULL A character string to be used as a short figure caption.

name: fig.subcap
description: A character string to be used as captions in sub-figures in LaTex.

name: fig.show
description: If 'hide', knitr will generate the plots created in the chunk, but not include them in the final document. If 'hold', knitr will delay displaying the plots created by the chunk until the end of the chunk. If 'animate', knitr will combine all of the plots created by the chunk into an animation.

name: fig.showtext
description: If TRUE, knitr will call showtext::showtext.begin() before drawing plots.

name: out.extra
description: A character string of extra options for figures to be passed to LaTex or HTML.

name: out.height
description: The height and height to scale plots to in the final output. Can be in units recognized by output, e.g. 8\\linewidth, 50px

name: out.width
description: The width and height to scale plots to in the final output. Can be in units recognized by output, e.g. 8\\linewidth, 50px

name: resize.height
description: The height and height to resize tike graphics in LaTex, passed to \resizebox{}{}.

name: resize.width
description: The width and height to resize tike graphics in LaTex, passed to \resizebox{}{}.

name: sanitize
description: If TRUE, knitr will sanitize tike graphics for LaTex.
